intro: Limonium linguum, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and spiny, silver-green foliage that helps it thrive in salty, windy environments. The plant belongs to the Plumbagaceae family and is often found in sandy or limestone soils along the shorelines. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice for coastal gardens and landscaping. Limonium linguum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom throughout the summer months.
